Summary of Catplat CLI Sub-commandsÔÉÅ

Sub-command 1

Sub-command 2

Description

analyze

adsorbate

Analyze adsorbate structure.

analyze

bulk

Analyze bulk structure.

analyze

complex

Analyze complex structure.

analyze

miller

Analyze bulk structure to obtain facet-like miller indices.

analyze

sites

Analyze adsorption sites of a slab.

analyze

slab

Analyze slab structure.

build

adsorbate

Create/Write adsorbate structures.

build

bulk

Create/Write bulk structures.

build

complex

Create/Write complex structures.

build

multicomplex

Create/Write multi-adsorbate complex structures.

build

slab

Create/Write slab structures.

calculate

-

Run Catplat workflow calculations.

config

-

Set up new project/view current project settings.

database

backup

Backup database to file.

dryrun

-

Trial run for catplat claculate.

entry

delete

Delete selected entries.

entry

delete-key

Delete attribute keys.

entry

ignore

Ignore selected entries.

entry

update-key

Update existing values.

entry

view

View data from selected entries.

entry

write

Write data from selected entries.

extract

-

Extract calculation information from folders.

laspinit

-

Create Initial/Transition/Final structures for LASP-CBD.

retrieve

-

Queries the database.

test

db

Test database integrity.

test

self

Quick test for tunnel and db integrity.

test

tunnel

Test sql tunnel.

HelpÔÉÅ

You may get more details of the options available by running the command with the --help option.

$ catplat --help
$ catplat sub-command-1 --help
$ catplat sub-command-1 --sub-command-1-required-options sub-command-2 --help

DocumentationÔÉÅ

catplatÔÉÅ

catplat [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

Options

--stream-logÔÉÅ
--logÔÉÅ
--verboseÔÉÅ
--versionÔÉÅ

analyzeÔÉÅ

Analyze properties of structure files.

catplat analyze [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...
adsorbateÔÉÅ

Analyze adsorbate structure.

Example:

catplat analyze adsorbate ‚Äìname CO

catplat analyze adsorbate [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>ÔÉÅ

Required

bulkÔÉÅ

Analyze bulk structure.

Example:

catplat analyze bulk ‚Äìname Cu_bulk

catplat analyze bulk [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>ÔÉÅ

Required

complexÔÉÅ

Analyze complex structure.

Gives the percentage of images in top, bridge, three-fold, and four-fold hollow sites.

Example:

catplat analyze complex -n POSCAR_Rh36_O2 ‚Äìslab-elements Rh ‚Äìadsorbate O2

catplat analyze complex [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>ÔÉÅ

Required

-a, --adsorbate <adsorbate>ÔÉÅ

Required

-s, --slab-elements <slab_elements>ÔÉÅ

Required

-v, --verbose, --no-verboseÔÉÅ
--num-processes <num_processes>ÔÉÅ
--solfilter, --no-solfilterÔÉÅ

Removes solvent (H2O) molecules from images. Requires solvation package

millerÔÉÅ

Analyze bulk structure to obtain facet-like miller indices.

Example:

catplat analyze miller ‚Äìname Cu_bulk ‚Äìfacet 111 ‚Äìmax-index 3

catplat analyze miller [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>ÔÉÅ

Required

-f, --facet <facet>ÔÉÅ

Required Facet of the surface i.e. 111, 100, 211.

-i, --max-index <max_index>ÔÉÅ

Maximum index to trial.

sitesÔÉÅ

Analyze adsorption sites of a slab.

Example:

catplat analyze sites -n SLAB_POSCAR

catplat analyze sites [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>ÔÉÅ

Required

--sites-in-cell, --no-sites-in-cellÔÉÅ

Filter sites in cell.

-c, --connectivity <connectivity>ÔÉÅ

Filter connectivity.

-a, --avg-coord-num <avg_coord_num>ÔÉÅ

Filter average coordination number.

-i, --sites <sites>ÔÉÅ

Filter site indices.

--unique, --no-uniqueÔÉÅ

Filter unique site.

slabÔÉÅ

Analyze slab structure.

Example:

catplat analyze slab -n Pt111

catplat analyze slab [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>ÔÉÅ

Required

buildÔÉÅ

Build/Write structures.

catplat build [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...
adsorbateÔÉÅ

Create/Write adsorbate structures.

Example:

# some adsorbates are available in the database catplat build adsorbate -n CO ‚Äìbox-size 10

# single atom adsorbates catplat build adsorbate -n atom:Cl ‚Äìbox-size 10

# generate adsorbate from smiles catplat build adsorbate -n ‚Äúpubchem:CC(O)=O‚Äù ‚Äìbox-size 10

# generate adsorbate from pubchem id catplat build adsorbate -n pubchem:281 ‚Äìbox-size 10

# generate adsorbate from name catplat build adsorbate -n pubchem:Ethanol ‚Äìbox-size 10

catplat build adsorbate [OPTIONS]

Options

-n, --name <name>ÔÉÅ

Required

--boxsize, --box-size <boxsize>ÔÉÅ
--write, --no-writeÔÉÅ

Write structures into folders

bulkÔÉÅ

Create/Write bulk structures.

Example:

# get the stable fcc Cu bulk catplat build bulk ‚Äìchemsys Cu ‚Äìe-above-hull ‚Äú<0.01‚Äù ‚Äìspacegroup 225 ‚Äìmpid mp-30

# get all the stable binary Cu-* bulks catplat build bulk ‚Äìchemsys Cu-* ‚Äìe-above-hull ‚Äú<0.01‚Äù ‚Äìspacegroup 225

catplat build bulk [OPTIONS]

Options

-c, --chemsys <chemsys>ÔÉÅ

Species of the system, sorted alphabetically and separated by dashes. eg. ‚Äìchemsys Cu-Rh

-e, --e-above-hull <e_above_hull>ÔÉÅ

Energy above hull of the bulk structure as indicated on Materials Project. Comparator strings are preferred over float unless exact match is desired.

-f, --bulk-formula <bulk_formula>ÔÉÅ

Bulk formula as indicated on Materials Project.

-s, --spacegroup <spacegroup>ÔÉÅ

Spacegroup number of bulk as indicated on Materials Project.

-i, --mpid <mpid>ÔÉÅ

Materials Project ID of bulk structure

--write, --no-writeÔÉÅ

Write structures into folders

complexÔÉÅ

Create/Write complex structures.

Example:

# monodentate CH3 on top site, rotated 30 degrees catplat build complex -s Pt111 -a CH3 ‚Äìbonds ‚Äú[0]‚Äù ‚Äìconnectivity ‚Äú[1]‚Äù ‚Äìrotation 30

# bind adsorbate on site 40 catplat build complex -s Pt111 -a CH3 ‚Äìsites ‚Äú[40]‚Äù

# bidentate O2 on top-top site catplat build complex -s Pt111 -a O2 ‚Äìbonds ‚Äú[0,1]‚Äù ‚Äìconnectivity ‚Äú[1,1]‚Äù

catplat build complex [OPTIONS]

Options

-a, --adsorbate-atoms, --adsorbate <adsorbate_atoms>ÔÉÅ

Required Name of adsorbate.Accepted inputs:(1) ‚Äúpath/to/X.xyz‚Äù (2) ‚ÄúX‚Äù if X.* in user/catplat adsorbate directory (3) ‚ÄúX‚Äù if X in ase.collections.g2 (4) ‚Äúatom:X‚Äù (5) ‚Äúpubchem:X‚Äù

-b, --bonds <bonds>ÔÉÅ

Atom index of adsorbate to bind to the slab. e.g. -b 0 -b 0,1 -b monodentate‚Äù

-c, --connectivity <connectivity>ÔÉÅ

Connectivity of adsorption site for adsorbate to bind. e.g. e.g. -c 1 -c 1,1

-n, --avg-coord-num <avg_coord_num>ÔÉÅ

Average coordination of adsorption site for adsorbate to bind. e.g. -n 7 -n 7,7 -n ‚Äú<=8‚Äù, -n ‚Äú<8,7‚Äù

-i, --sites <sites>ÔÉÅ

Site indexes to be selected. e.g. e.g. -i 40 -i 40,41

--write, --no-writeÔÉÅ

Write structures into folders

--rotation <rotation>ÔÉÅ

Rotation of adsorbate.

-s, --slab <slab>ÔÉÅ

Name of slab file in user slab directory.

--unique, --no-uniqueÔÉÅ

Whether or not to get unique sites only.

--write-schematic, --no-write-schematicÔÉÅ

Write schematics

--randomÔÉÅ

Select a random adsorption site

multicomplexÔÉÅ

Create/Write multi-adsorbate complex structures.

Example:

# coadsorb 2 x CO on Cu(100) slab. Only considering top and bridge sites, always include site 40, catplat build multicomplex -s Pt111 -a CO -q 2 ‚Äìbonds 0 ‚Äìconnectivity 1,2 ‚Äìsites 40

catplat build multicomplex [OPTIONS]

Options

-a, --adsorbate-atoms, --adsorbate <adsorbate_atoms>ÔÉÅ

Required Name of adsorbate.Accepted inputs:(1) ‚Äúpath/to/X.xyz‚Äù (2) ‚ÄúX‚Äù if X.* in user/catplat adsorbate directory (3) ‚ÄúX‚Äù if X in ase.collections.g2 (4) ‚Äúatom:X‚Äù (5) ‚Äúpubchem:X‚Äù

-b, --bonds <bonds>ÔÉÅ

Atom index of adsorbate to bind to the slab. e.g. -b 0 -b 0,1 -b monodentate‚Äù

-c, --connectivity <connectivity>ÔÉÅ

Connectivity of adsorption site for adsorbate to bind. e.g. e.g. -c 1 -c 1,1

-n, --avg-coord-num <avg_coord_num>ÔÉÅ

Average coordination of adsorption site for adsorbate to bind. e.g. -n 7 -n 7,7 -n ‚Äú<=8‚Äù, -n ‚Äú<8,7‚Äù

-i, --sites <sites>ÔÉÅ

Site indexes to be selected. e.g. e.g. -i 40 -i 40,41

--write, --no-writeÔÉÅ

Write structures into folders

-s, --slab-atoms, --slab <slab_atoms>ÔÉÅ

Required Name of slab file in user slab directory. When slab is specified, other bulk and slab attributes should not be specified.

-q, --quantity <quantity>ÔÉÅ

Required Number of adsorbates to adsorb on the slab.

--dist-tol <dist_tol>ÔÉÅ

Filter structures that have adsorbates in close proximity, defaults to 0.8*{top-top distance}.

--write-schematic, --no-write-schematicÔÉÅ

Write schematics

slabÔÉÅ

Create/Write slab structures.

Example:

# Cu(100) slab with 5 layers, 3 fixed layers, 15A vacuum, 4x4 unit cell and a Rh overlayer catplat build slab -n Cu_bulk ‚Äìoverlayer Rh ‚Äìmiller-index 1 0 0 ‚Äìnum-layers 5 ‚Äìnum-fixed-layers 3 ‚Äìvacuum 15 ‚Äìunitcell-size 4 4

# Cu(211) slab catplat build slab -n Cu_bulk ‚Äìmiller-index 2 1 1 ‚Äìnum-layers 12 ‚Äìnum-fixed-layers 6 ‚Äìunitcell-size 1 3

# Specify slab size by minimum dimensions catplat build slab -n Cu_bulk ‚Äìmiller-index 1 0 0 ‚Äìlength 10 10 ‚Äìthickness 10

catplat build slab [OPTIONS]

Options

-o, --overlayer <overlayer>ÔÉÅ

Replaces top layer atoms with overlayer atoms.

-m, --miller-index, --miller <miller_index>ÔÉÅ

Required Miller idx of slab. eg. ‚Äìmiller-index 1 1 1

-s, --unitcell-size <unitcell_size>ÔÉÅ

Size of slab to be created.

-l, --num-layers <num_layers>ÔÉÅ

Number of layers of the slab.

-f, --num-fixed-layers <num_fixed_layers>ÔÉÅ

Number of layers to be fixed.

-v, --vacuum <vacuum>ÔÉÅ

Amount of vacuum (in angstroms) to add on ‚Äúeach side‚Äù of the slab (i.e., total vacuum = vauum x 2) Vacuum should be an int.

--conventional <conventional>ÔÉÅ

Toggle for creation of conventional slabs.

--length <length>ÔÉÅ

Length (√Ö) of the slab.

--thickness <thickness>ÔÉÅ

Thickness (√Ö) of the slab.

--write, --no-writeÔÉÅ

Write structures into folders

-n, --name <name>ÔÉÅ

Required Path to bulk file or name of bulk file in user bulk directory

--rotate <rotate>ÔÉÅ

Rotate the slabs around the z-axis by the specified amount.

--sort-z, --no-sort-zÔÉÅ

Sort slabs by their z-axis positions

--view, --no-viewÔÉÅ

View slabs via GUI.

calculateÔÉÅ

Run Catplat workflow calculations.

Obtains results of specified system by first searching the database. If the results do not exist, calculate using DFT.

Examples:
catplat calculate ‚Äìproject <myproject> ‚Äìchemsys Cu
catplat calculate [OPTIONS]

Options

-p, --project <project>ÔÉÅ

Required Name of project to run. Contains information such as database_path, incar settings, etc.

--bulk-atoms <bulk_atoms>ÔÉÅ

Name of bulk file in user bulk directory. When bulk is specified, other bulk attributes such as e_above_hull should not be specified.

--chemsys <chemsys>ÔÉÅ

Chemical species of the bulk. Multiple elements should be separated by dashes. e.g. ‚Äìchemsys Cu-Rh

--min-e-above-hull <min_e_above_hull>ÔÉÅ

Minimum energy above hull of the bulk structure as indicated on Materials Project. [eV/atom]

--max-e-above-hull <max_e_above_hull>ÔÉÅ

Maximum energy above hull of the bulk structure as indicated on Materials Project. [eV/atom]

--bulk-formula <bulk_formula>ÔÉÅ

Bulk formula as indicated on Materials Project. e.g. ‚Äìbulk-formula Cu3Rh

--spacegroup <spacegroup>ÔÉÅ

Spacegroup number of bulk as indicated on Materials Project.

--mpid <mpid>ÔÉÅ

Materials Project ID of bulk structure

-s, --slab-atoms <slab_atoms>ÔÉÅ

Name of slab file in user slab directory. When slab is specified, other bulk and slab attributes should not be specified.

--termination <termination>ÔÉÅ

Slab termination, defined as the composition of the surface layer..

-o, --overlayer <overlayer>ÔÉÅ

If specified, replaces top layer atoms with overlayer atoms.

-m, --miller-index, --miller <miller_index>ÔÉÅ

Miller idx of slab. eg. ‚Äìmiller-index 1 1 1

--unitcell-size <unitcell_size>ÔÉÅ

Size of slab to be created in terms of number of unit cell repeats.

-l, --num-layers <num_layers>ÔÉÅ

Number of layers of the slab.

-f, --num-fixed-layers <num_fixed_layers>ÔÉÅ

Number of layers to be fixed.

-v, --min-vacuum <min_vacuum>ÔÉÅ

Minimum vacuum to add on each side of the slab (i.e., total vacuum = vacuum x 2). [√Ö]

--conventional <conventional>ÔÉÅ

Toggle for creation of conventional slabs.

--min-length <min_length>ÔÉÅ

Minimum length of the slab x and y vectors respectively. [√Ö]

--min-thickness <min_thickness>ÔÉÅ

Minimum thickness of the slab. [√Ö]

--min-fixed-thickness <min_fixed_thickness>ÔÉÅ

Minimum fixed layers thickness of the slab. [√Ö]

-a, --adsorbate-atoms <adsorbate_atoms>ÔÉÅ

Name of adsorbate.Accepted inputs:(1) ‚Äúpath/to/X.xyz‚Äù (2) ‚ÄúX‚Äù if X.* in user/catplat adsorbate directory (3) ‚ÄúX‚Äù if X in ase.collections.g2 (4) ‚Äúatom:X‚Äù (5) ‚Äúpubchem:X‚Äù if X is a pubchem id or name

-b, --bonds <bonds>ÔÉÅ

Atom index of adsorbate to bind to the slab. Single integer for monodentate adsorbates. Comma-separated integers for bidentate adsorbates. ‚ÄúMonodentate‚Äù/‚Äùbidentate‚Äù can be specified for CatPlat to automatically determine the binding atoms.e.g. -b 0 -b 0,1 -b monodentate‚Äù

-c, --connectivity <connectivity>ÔÉÅ

Connectivity is the number of surface atoms of adsorption site that the adsorbate binds to. For a fcc(111) surface, for example, ‚Äú1‚Äù is the top site, ‚Äú2‚Äù is the bridge site. Single integer for monodentate adsorbates. Comma-separated integers for bidentate adsorbates. e.g. -c 1 -c 1,1

-n, --avg-coord-num <avg_coord_num>ÔÉÅ

Average coordination number of adsorption site that the adsorbate binds to. Can be an integer e.g. 7, or comparator e.g. <7. Single values for monodentate adsorbates. Comma-separated values for bidentate adsorbates. e.g. -n 7 -n 7,7 -n ‚Äú<=8‚Äù, -n ‚Äú<8,7‚Äù

-r, --rotation <rotation>ÔÉÅ

Rotation of adsorbate around the axis of adsorption. For monodentate adsorbates only.

--ml-preoptimization, --ml-preoptÔÉÅ

Flag to run preoptimization with MLPotential. Will default to True if ‚Äìml-potential-hash is specified.

--ml-potential-hash <ml_potential_hash>ÔÉÅ

Hash of the MLPotential to be used for preoptimization.

--skip-materials-projectÔÉÅ

Flag to skip querying Materials Project.

-n, --num-nodes <num_nodes>ÔÉÅ

Number of nodes to assign for each num-job-run-slots.

-N, --num-job-run-slots <num_job_run_slots>ÔÉÅ

Number of jobs to run in parallel.

--testÔÉÅ

Flag for testing. Results will not be written to the database.

--server <server>ÔÉÅ

Name of server to run the job on. Will try to determine this automatically if unspecified.

--fakerunnerÔÉÅ

Flag to use FakeVaspOverallJobRunner(). Results will be written to the database with placeholder energy value of 123.0 eV.

--write-db, --no-write-dbÔÉÅ

If true, writes calculations of current session to {session_id}.db

configÔÉÅ

Set up new project/view current project settings.

catplat config [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

Options

--user-settings-dir <user_settings_dir>ÔÉÅ

For advanced use only.

projectÔÉÅ

Configures the project name and associated path where the calculations and database for the project will reside.

catplat config project [OPTIONS]

Options

--name <name>ÔÉÅ

Required Set project name

--calculation-path, --calc-path <calculation_path>ÔÉÅ

Required Set calculation path for project.

--database-path, --db-path <database_path>ÔÉÅ

Required Set database path for project.

--initial-magmom-threshold <initial_magmom_threshold>ÔÉÅ

Sets the threshold below which, the bulk initial magmoms retrieved from the MaterialsProjectwill be removed to avoid triggering spin-polarized calculations.

showÔÉÅ

Displays the METADATA file in user_project_settings.

catplat config show [OPTIONS]
userÔÉÅ

Sets the main user catplat settings.

catplat config user [OPTIONS]

Options

--run-dir <run_dir>ÔÉÅ

Set catplat run directory.

--mysql-user <mysql_user>ÔÉÅ

Set SQL user.

--mysql-pwd <mysql_pwd>ÔÉÅ

Set sql password.

--mysql-host <mysql_host>ÔÉÅ

Set sql host.

databaseÔÉÅ

Perform operations involving the whole database.

Can either specify a project name or a database file.

catplat database [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

Options

-p, --project <project>ÔÉÅ

Name of project containing the database_path.

-f, --file <file>ÔÉÅ

Name of database file.

backupÔÉÅ

Backup database to file.

Examples:
# Backup database to file
catplat database -p project backup ‚Äìdst backup.db
catplat database backup [OPTIONS]

Options

--dst, --destination <dst>ÔÉÅ

Required

--appendÔÉÅ
--overwriteÔÉÅ
upgradeÔÉÅ

Upgrade database to a new version.

Examples:
# Upgrade database to latest version
catplat database -p project upgrade ‚Äìdst upgraded.db

# Upgrade database to a specific version catplat database -p project upgrade ‚Äìdst upgraded.db ‚Äìversion 23.10.5

catplat database upgrade [OPTIONS]

Options

--dst, --destination <dst>ÔÉÅ

Required

--version <version>ÔÉÅ

Version to upgrade to. If not specified, upgrade to latest version.

downloadÔÉÅ

Download external resources for catplat.

catplat download [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...
resourcesÔÉÅ

Download ML potentials for catplat to user directory.

catplat download resources [OPTIONS]

dryrunÔÉÅ

Quickly view structures created by catplat for the corresponding QuerySet.

Examples:
catplat dryrun ‚Äìchemsys Cu
catplat dryrun [OPTIONS]

Options

--cleanup, --no-cleanupÔÉÅ

Whether to clean up the project directory after calculation.

--bulk-atoms <bulk_atoms>ÔÉÅ

Name of bulk file in user bulk directory. When bulk is specified, other bulk attributes such as e_above_hull should not be specified.

--chemsys <chemsys>ÔÉÅ

Chemical species of the bulk. Multiple elements should be separated by dashes. e.g. ‚Äìchemsys Cu-Rh

--min-e-above-hull <min_e_above_hull>ÔÉÅ

Minimum energy above hull of the bulk structure as indicated on Materials Project. [eV/atom]

--max-e-above-hull <max_e_above_hull>ÔÉÅ

Maximum energy above hull of the bulk structure as indicated on Materials Project. [eV/atom]

--bulk-formula <bulk_formula>ÔÉÅ

Bulk formula as indicated on Materials Project. e.g. ‚Äìbulk-formula Cu3Rh

--spacegroup <spacegroup>ÔÉÅ

Spacegroup number of bulk as indicated on Materials Project.

--mpid <mpid>ÔÉÅ

Materials Project ID of bulk structure

-s, --slab-atoms <slab_atoms>ÔÉÅ

Name of slab file in user slab directory. When slab is specified, other bulk and slab attributes should not be specified.

--termination <termination>ÔÉÅ

Slab termination, defined as the composition of the surface layer..

-o, --overlayer <overlayer>ÔÉÅ

If specified, replaces top layer atoms with overlayer atoms.

-m, --miller-index, --miller <miller_index>ÔÉÅ

Miller idx of slab. eg. ‚Äìmiller-index 1 1 1

--unitcell-size <unitcell_size>ÔÉÅ

Size of slab to be created in terms of number of unit cell repeats.

-l, --num-layers <num_layers>ÔÉÅ

Number of layers of the slab.

-f, --num-fixed-layers <num_fixed_layers>ÔÉÅ

Number of layers to be fixed.

-v, --min-vacuum <min_vacuum>ÔÉÅ

Minimum vacuum to add on each side of the slab (i.e., total vacuum = vacuum x 2). [√Ö]

--conventional <conventional>ÔÉÅ

Toggle for creation of conventional slabs.

--min-length <min_length>ÔÉÅ

Minimum length of the slab x and y vectors respectively. [√Ö]

--min-thickness <min_thickness>ÔÉÅ

Minimum thickness of the slab. [√Ö]

--min-fixed-thickness <min_fixed_thickness>ÔÉÅ

Minimum fixed layers thickness of the slab. [√Ö]

-a, --adsorbate-atoms <adsorbate_atoms>ÔÉÅ

Name of adsorbate.Accepted inputs:(1) ‚Äúpath/to/X.xyz‚Äù (2) ‚ÄúX‚Äù if X.* in user/catplat adsorbate directory (3) ‚ÄúX‚Äù if X in ase.collections.g2 (4) ‚Äúatom:X‚Äù (5) ‚Äúpubchem:X‚Äù if X is a pubchem id or name

-b, --bonds <bonds>ÔÉÅ

Atom index of adsorbate to bind to the slab. Single integer for monodentate adsorbates. Comma-separated integers for bidentate adsorbates. ‚ÄúMonodentate‚Äù/‚Äùbidentate‚Äù can be specified for CatPlat to automatically determine the binding atoms.e.g. -b 0 -b 0,1 -b monodentate‚Äù

-c, --connectivity <connectivity>ÔÉÅ

Connectivity is the number of surface atoms of adsorption site that the adsorbate binds to. For a fcc(111) surface, for example, ‚Äú1‚Äù is the top site, ‚Äú2‚Äù is the bridge site. Single integer for monodentate adsorbates. Comma-separated integers for bidentate adsorbates. e.g. -c 1 -c 1,1

-n, --avg-coord-num <avg_coord_num>ÔÉÅ

Average coordination number of adsorption site that the adsorbate binds to. Can be an integer e.g. 7, or comparator e.g. <7. Single values for monodentate adsorbates. Comma-separated values for bidentate adsorbates. e.g. -n 7 -n 7,7 -n ‚Äú<=8‚Äù, -n ‚Äú<8,7‚Äù

-r, --rotation <rotation>ÔÉÅ

Rotation of adsorbate around the axis of adsorption. For monodentate adsorbates only.

--ml-preoptimization, --ml-preoptÔÉÅ

Flag to run preoptimization with MLPotential. Will default to True if ‚Äìml-potential-hash is specified.

--ml-potential-hash <ml_potential_hash>ÔÉÅ

Hash of the MLPotential to be used for preoptimization.

--skip-materials-projectÔÉÅ

Flag to skip querying Materials Project.

entryÔÉÅ

Perform operations on database entries. ie view attributes, set ignore flag etc.

catplat entry [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

Options

-p, --project <project>ÔÉÅ

Required Name of project containing the database_path.

--id <id>ÔÉÅ

Required Database id to be edited.

deleteÔÉÅ

Delete selected entries.

Examples:
# delete id1 and id2
catplat entry -p project ‚Äìid 1 ‚Äìid 2 delete
catplat entry delete [OPTIONS]
delete-keyÔÉÅ

Delete attribute keys.

Examples:
# remove version and ignored attributes from id 1
catplat entry -p project ‚Äìid 1 delete-key ‚Äìkey version ‚Äìkey ignored
catplat entry delete-key [OPTIONS]

Options

--key <key>ÔÉÅ

Required Attribute keys to be deleted

ignoreÔÉÅ

Ignore selected entries.

Examples:
# ignore id1 and id2:
catplat entry -p project ‚Äìid 1 ‚Äìid 2 ignore

# undo ignore for id1 and id2: catplat entry -p project ‚Äìid 1 ‚Äìid 2 ignore ‚Äìno-ignore

catplat entry ignore [OPTIONS]

Options

--ignore, --no-ignoreÔÉÅ

Flag to set ignored to True or False.

update-keyÔÉÅ

Update existing values.

Examples:
# update the value of ignored to True
catplat entry -p project ‚Äìid 1 update-key ‚Äìkey ignored ‚Äìvalue True ‚Äìtyping bool

# insert new attribute kvps catplat entry -p project ‚Äìid 1 update-key ‚Äìkey keyname ‚Äìvalue 100 ‚Äìtyping float

catplat entry update-key [OPTIONS]

Options

--key <key>ÔÉÅ

Required Attribute key to be updated.

--value <value>ÔÉÅ

Required Value to be updated to.

--typing <typing>ÔÉÅ

Data type of the value. Typing should be str, int, float or bool.

viewÔÉÅ

View data from selected entries.

Examples:
# prints details of id1, id2 and id3 and visualizes their structures
catplat entry -p project ‚Äìid 1 ‚Äìid 2 ‚Äìid 3 view ‚Äìstruct
catplat entry view [OPTIONS]

Options

--struct, --no-structÔÉÅ

Toggle to visualize the structure.

--traj, --no-trajÔÉÅ

Toggle to visualize the relaxation trajectory in animation.

writeÔÉÅ

Write data from selected entries.

Examples:
# writes structures, full trajectories and the VASP files for id1, id2 and id3
catplat entry -p project ‚Äìid 1 ‚Äìid 2 ‚Äìid 3 write ‚Äìstruct ‚Äìfull-traj ‚Äìfiles
catplat entry write [OPTIONS]

Options

--csv, --no-csvÔÉÅ

Toggle to write the results in csv format.

--csv-filename <csv_filename>ÔÉÅ

name of the csv file to be written, can include a full path.

--id-path <id_path>ÔÉÅ

the path corrspoding to the id(s) mentioned before where all relevant files will be written

--struct, --no-structÔÉÅ

Toggle to write the structure in POSCAR format.

--full-traj, --no-full-trajÔÉÅ

Toggle to write the full trajectyory in ASE traj format.

--traj-gif, --no-traj-gifÔÉÅ

Toggle to write an animated GIF file for the full trajectory.

--files, --no-filesÔÉÅ

Toggle to write the INCAR, KPOINTS, POTCAR and outputs.json files.

extractÔÉÅ

Extract calculation information from folders.

Either update the corresponding relaxed entries in the database or store them anew. | Examples: | catplat extract -p projectname -f ‚Äò/path/to/job1‚Äô -f ‚Äò/path/to/job2‚Äô ‚Äìid unrelaxedid1 ‚Äìid unrelaxedid2 ‚Äìparallel ‚Äìnp 2 | catplat extract -p projectname -f ‚Äò/path/to/lot_of_jobs/id*‚Äô ‚Äìoverwrite ‚Äìnp -1

catplat extract [OPTIONS]

Options

-p, --project <project>ÔÉÅ

Required Name of project containing the database_path.

-f, --folder <folder>ÔÉÅ

Required the path of the folder(s) from which to extract the caulation data from, must be provided under quotes, e.g. -f ‚Äúsome/path‚Äù

--id <id>ÔÉÅ

Database id of the unrelaxed entry whose corresponding relaxed entry is to be edited.

--overwrite, --no-overwriteÔÉÅ

Toggle to overwrite the existing data section, if one is found

--np <np>ÔÉÅ

Number of parallel threads. Use np=-1 to utilize the maximum number of available threads

--suppress-errors, --no-supress-errorsÔÉÅ

Toggle to silently skip the undesired, normally error-raising cases

--backend <backend>ÔÉÅ

the parallelization backend. options are ‚Äújoblib‚Äù and ‚Äúmultiprocessing‚Äù

--chunksize <chunksize>ÔÉÅ

the chunksize option of multiprocessing.Pool.starmap

laspinitÔÉÅ

Create Initial/Transition/Final structures for LASP-CBD.

catplat laspinit [OPTIONS]

Options

-f, --file <file>ÔÉÅ

Required Path to initial structure.

-i, --diss-idx <diss_idx>ÔÉÅ

Required List indicating containing atom index of bond breaking. eg. -i 77 73

-s, --slab-elements <slab_elements>ÔÉÅ

The element(s) of the slab. eg. -s Rh -s Pd

-c1, --ads1-connectivity <ads1_connectivity>ÔÉÅ

Connectivity for adsorbate 1.

-c2, --ads2-connectivity <ads2_connectivity>ÔÉÅ

Connectivity for adsorbate 2.

-a1, --ads1-acn <ads1_acn>ÔÉÅ

avg_coord_num for adsorbate 1.

-a2, --ads2-acn <ads2_acn>ÔÉÅ

avg_coord_num for adsorbate 2

--ads1-bind, --no-ads1-bindÔÉÅ

Toggle to bind adsorbate 1 to the slab. (default=True)

--ads2-bind, --no-ads2-bindÔÉÅ

Toggle to bind adsorbate 2 to the slab. (default=True)

--ads1-dir-filter, --no-ads1-dir-filterÔÉÅ

Toggle to filter sites for adsorbate 1 that are in the same direction as the dissociation vector. (default=True)

--ads2-dir-filter, --no-ads2-dir-filterÔÉÅ

Toggle to filter sites for adsorbate 2 that are in the same direction as the dissociation vector. (default=False)

--ads1-dist-filter, --no-ads1-dist-filterÔÉÅ

Toggle to filter sites for adsorbate 1 that are too close. (default=True)

--ads2-dist-filter, --no-ads2-dist-filterÔÉÅ

Toggle to filter sites for adsorbate 2 that are too close. (default=False)

-x1, --ads1-dist-tol <ads1_dist_tol>ÔÉÅ

Tolerance parameter for ads1_dist_filter (default=1.5) Syntax: -x1 1.5

-x2, --ads2-dist-tol <ads2_dist_tol>ÔÉÅ

Tolerance parameter for ads2_dist_filter (default=1.5) Syntax: -x2 1.5

-y1, --ads1-dir-tol <ads1_dir_tol>ÔÉÅ

Tolerance parameter for ads1_dir_tol (default=0.5) Syntax: -y1 0.5

-y2, --ads2-dir-tol <ads2_dir_tol>ÔÉÅ

Tolerance parameter for ads2_dir_tol (default=0.5) Syntax: -y2 0.5

-t, --ts-tol <ts_tol>ÔÉÅ

Distance to increase bond length by for the transition state. (default=0.5) Syntax: -t 0.5

--zoom, --no-zoomÔÉÅ

Toggle to select IS and FS that is closer to the TS. (default=True)

-z, --zoom-tol <zoom_tol>ÔÉÅ

Distance to of bond length dbetween IS-TS-FS. (default=0.3) Syntax: -z 0.3

mlpÔÉÅ

Commands related to ML potentials.

catplat mlp [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...
viewÔÉÅ

View all MLPs available to catplat.

catplat mlp view [OPTIONS]

projectsÔÉÅ

View current projects.

catplat projects [OPTIONS]

retrieveÔÉÅ

Queries the database.

Obtains results of specified system by searching the database only.

Examples:
catplat retrieve ‚Äìproject <myproject> ‚Äìchemsys Cu
catplat retrieve [OPTIONS]

Options

-p, --project <project>ÔÉÅ

Required Name of project to run. Contains information such as database_path, incar settings, etc.

--bulk-atoms <bulk_atoms>ÔÉÅ

Name of bulk file in user bulk directory. When bulk is specified, other bulk attributes such as e_above_hull should not be specified.

--chemsys <chemsys>ÔÉÅ

Chemical species of the bulk. Multiple elements should be separated by dashes. e.g. ‚Äìchemsys Cu-Rh

--min-e-above-hull <min_e_above_hull>ÔÉÅ

Minimum energy above hull of the bulk structure as indicated on Materials Project. [eV/atom]

--max-e-above-hull <max_e_above_hull>ÔÉÅ

Maximum energy above hull of the bulk structure as indicated on Materials Project. [eV/atom]

--bulk-formula <bulk_formula>ÔÉÅ

Bulk formula as indicated on Materials Project. e.g. ‚Äìbulk-formula Cu3Rh

--spacegroup <spacegroup>ÔÉÅ

Spacegroup number of bulk as indicated on Materials Project.

--mpid <mpid>ÔÉÅ

Materials Project ID of bulk structure

--bulk-provenance <bulk_provenance>ÔÉÅ

String for the origin of bulk atoms.

-s, --slab-atoms <slab_atoms>ÔÉÅ

Name of slab file in user slab directory. When slab is specified, other bulk and slab attributes should not be specified.

--termination <termination>ÔÉÅ

Slab termination, defined as the composition of the surface layer..

-o, --overlayer <overlayer>ÔÉÅ

If specified, replaces top layer atoms with overlayer atoms.

-m, --miller-index, --miller <miller_index>ÔÉÅ

Miller idx of slab. eg. ‚Äìmiller-index 1 1 1

--unitcell-size <unitcell_size>ÔÉÅ

Size of slab to be created in terms of number of unit cell repeats.

-l, --num-layers <num_layers>ÔÉÅ

Number of layers of the slab.

-f, --num-fixed-layers <num_fixed_layers>ÔÉÅ

Number of layers to be fixed.

-v, --min-vacuum <min_vacuum>ÔÉÅ

Minimum vacuum to add on each side of the slab (i.e., total vacuum = vacuum x 2). [√Ö]

--conventional <conventional>ÔÉÅ

Toggle for creation of conventional slabs.

--min-length <min_length>ÔÉÅ

Minimum length of the slab x and y vectors respectively. [√Ö]

--min-thickness <min_thickness>ÔÉÅ

Minimum thickness of the slab. [√Ö]

--min-fixed-thickness <min_fixed_thickness>ÔÉÅ

Minimum fixed layers thickness of the slab. [√Ö]

--slab-provenance <slab_provenance>ÔÉÅ

String for the origin of slab atoms.

--max-vacuum <max_vacuum>ÔÉÅ

Maxmimum vacuum (in Angstroms) to add on each side of the slab (i.e., total vacuum = vauum x 2).

--max-length <max_length>ÔÉÅ

Maxmimum length(√Ö) of the slab x and y vectors respectively.

--max-thickness <max_thickness>ÔÉÅ

Maxmimum thickness(√Ö) of the slab.

--max-fixed-thickness <max_fixed_thickness>ÔÉÅ

Maxmimum fixed layers thickness(√Ö) of the slab.

--slab-chemsys <slab_chemsys>ÔÉÅ

Species of the slab, sorted alphabetically and separated by dashes.

--slab-formula <slab_formula>ÔÉÅ

Formula of the slab.

--min-slab-acn <min_slab_acn>ÔÉÅ

Minimum Average Coordination Number of the slab surface atoms.

--max-slab-acn <max_slab_acn>ÔÉÅ

Maximum Average Coordination Number of the slab surface atoms.

-a, --adsorbate-atoms <adsorbate_atoms>ÔÉÅ

Name of adsorbate.Accepted inputs:(1) ‚Äúpath/to/X.xyz‚Äù (2) ‚ÄúX‚Äù if X.* in user/catplat adsorbate directory (3) ‚ÄúX‚Äù if X in ase.collections.g2 (4) ‚Äúatom:X‚Äù (5) ‚Äúpubchem:X‚Äù if X is a pubchem id or name

-b, --bonds <bonds>ÔÉÅ

Atom index of adsorbate to bind to the slab. Single integer for monodentate adsorbates. Comma-separated integers for bidentate adsorbates. ‚ÄúMonodentate‚Äù/‚Äùbidentate‚Äù can be specified for CatPlat to automatically determine the binding atoms.e.g. -b 0 -b 0,1 -b monodentate‚Äù

-c, --connectivity <connectivity>ÔÉÅ

Connectivity is the number of surface atoms of adsorption site that the adsorbate binds to. For a fcc(111) surface, for example, ‚Äú1‚Äù is the top site, ‚Äú2‚Äù is the bridge site. Single integer for monodentate adsorbates. Comma-separated integers for bidentate adsorbates. e.g. -c 1 -c 1,1

-n, --avg-coord-num <avg_coord_num>ÔÉÅ

Average coordination number of adsorption site that the adsorbate binds to. Can be an integer e.g. 7, or comparator e.g. <7. Single values for monodentate adsorbates. Comma-separated values for bidentate adsorbates. e.g. -n 7 -n 7,7 -n ‚Äú<=8‚Äù, -n ‚Äú<8,7‚Äù

-r, --rotation <rotation>ÔÉÅ

Rotation of adsorbate around the axis of adsorption. For monodentate adsorbates only.

--adsorbate-formula <adsorbate_formula>ÔÉÅ

Formula of adsorbate.

--id <id>ÔÉÅ

Database id of query.

--workflow-type <workflow_type>ÔÉÅ

Workflow type of query. Three workflow types, namely, ‚Äúbulk‚Äù, ‚Äúslab‚Äù and ‚Äúadsorbate‚Äù.

--relaxed <relaxed>ÔÉÅ

Boolean specifying if structures to be queried are relaxed or not.

--unrelaxed_id <unrelaxed_id>ÔÉÅ

Unrelaxed database id of query.

--parent_id <parent_id>ÔÉÅ

Parent id of query.

--ml-preoptimization, --ml-preopt, --no-ml-preoptimization, --no-ml-preoptÔÉÅ
--write-csv, --no-write-csvÔÉÅ

Toggle to write the retrieved results in csv format.

--csv-filename <csv_filename>ÔÉÅ

name of the csv file to be written, can include a full path.

statisticsÔÉÅ

catplat statistics [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

Options

-p, --project <project>ÔÉÅ

Required Name of project containing the database_path.

entriesÔÉÅ
catplat statistics entries [OPTIONS]

testÔÉÅ

Test catplat.

catplat test [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...
dbÔÉÅ

Test database integrity. 1) Use ‚Äìdatabase-path if you want to test an existing database. 2) Use ‚Äìtest-case-1 for quick testing of a new catplat_version. 3) Use ‚Äìtest-case-1 and ‚Äìcalculate for comprehensive testing of a new catplat_version.

Examples:
catplat test db ‚Äìdatabase-path ~/path/to/database.db
catplat test db ‚Äìtest-case-1
catplat test db ‚Äìtest-case-1 ‚Äìcalculate ‚Äìserver asp2acpu -n 2 -N 2
‚Äìproject <myproject> ‚Äìchemsys Cu
catplat test db [OPTIONS]

Options

--test-case-1ÔÉÅ

Flag to run ‚Äútest-case-1‚Äù, tests the db output.

--calculateÔÉÅ

Flag to define if real calculations should be done for ‚Äútest-case-1‚Äù

--database-path, --db-path <database_path>ÔÉÅ

Path to database to be checked.

--server <server>ÔÉÅ

Name of server to run the job on. Will try to determine this automatically if unspecified.

-n, --num-nodes <num_nodes>ÔÉÅ

Number of nodes to assign for each num-job-run-slots.

-N, --num-job-run-slots <num_job_run_slots>ÔÉÅ

Number of jobs to run in parallel.

selfÔÉÅ

Quick test for tunnel and db integrity.

catplat test self [OPTIONS]
tunnelÔÉÅ

Test sql tunnel.

catplat test tunnel [OPTIONS]

tunnelÔÉÅ

Tunneling from compute nodes to the mysql server.

catplat tunnel [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...
createÔÉÅ

Create the tunnel.

catplat tunnel create [OPTIONS]

Options

--dst, --destination <dst>ÔÉÅ

Required

--debugÔÉÅ
destroyÔÉÅ

Destroy all tunnels.

catplat tunnel destroy [OPTIONS]

welcomeÔÉÅ

Prints the welcome message.

catplat welcome [OPTIONS]
